questions.question_text: In a BPEL model, what is the quickest way to implement a capability to skip rule execution if a particular condition holds?

choices.C: Include an XPath expression in an annotation on the business rule component.
choices.D: Use a correlation set on the business rule component.
choices.A: Model a switch activity to conditionally execute the business rule component.
choices.B: Use a skip condition on the business rule component.

discussion.content: A. Model a switch activity to conditionally execute the business rule component.

questions.question_text:
You have modeled a Composite X for which the following fault policy action has been configured for remote faults:
<Action id="ora-retry">
<retry>
<retryCount>2</retryCount>
<retryIntrval>2</retryIntrval>
<exponentialBackoff/>
</retry>
</Action>
At runtime, when a remote fault occurs on at outbound invoke, this ora-retry action is triggered. After the two configured retries are exhausted, which one occurs?

discussion.content: B. The instance is marked "open.faulted" and is available for auto-recovery.

choices.A: The transaction of Composite X rolls back.
choices.C: The instance is marked "closed.faulted" and is available for error recovery from Enterprise Manager where the user can choose actions on the instance such as replay, rethrow, and abort.
choices.B: The instance is marked "open.faulted" and is available for auto-recovery.
choices.D: The default retryFailureAction is initiated and it rethrows the error back to the caller service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?_afrLoop=74571933804725&parent=EXTERNAL_SEARCH&sourceId=HOWTO&id=1903013.1&_afrWindowMode=0&_adf.ctrl-state=t7b7ku7ct_4
Shows "How to enable TRACE for SOA" and it's pretty clearly from Enterprise Manager. I have also been able to set the SOA composite run to Developer mode from Enterprise Manager (to show more details on I/O variables) so this makes sense.

B. Enterprise Manager , please see link https://support.oracle.com/epmos/faces/DocumentDisplay?_afrLoop=74571933804725&parent=EXTERNAL_SEARCH&sourceId=HOWTO&id=1903013.1&_afrWindowMode=0&_adf.ctrl-state=t7b7ku7ct_4

questions.question_text: Which tool would you use to enable more detailed logging of SOA components?
Which expiration and escalation setting can be used to route a task a specified number of levels up a management chain if the assignee does not respond in a given time period?

discussion.content: C. with a Switch containing a case for each outcome of interest plus an optional otherwise case after the human task activity

questions.question_text: How are task outcomes processed in BPEL process?

choices.D: with a Switch containing one case for each possible outcome after the human task activity
choices.B: by using onMessage or pick activities that receive the outcome from the human workflow engine
choices.C: with a Switch containing a case for each outcome of interest plus an optional otherwise case after the human task activity
choices.A: by using a condition (present in each path of the human task activity) in which you specify the outcome that causes a particular path to be followed
